column4: Try #3: anybody out there know SSH *REALLY* well?  Someone who can take the error message "channel 3: open failed: administratively prohibited: open failed" and turn this into something that can be solved?
paste the -vvv output to pastebin
hang on a mo.
The paste limit gets WAAAAAAY exceeded by the output.
Explain?
ssh -L 3128:backdoor:3128 -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa backdoor -vvvvvvv -o ConnectTimeout=5
try put the full path of -i
I'm not having problems logging in.
here's the pastebin: http://paste.ubuntu.com/174092/
with -N now I don't get a command line prompt.
try the tunnel
same error, same problem.
Same error.  Same problem.  Could we please start looking at where the problem is: the server configuration?
i am still not 100% in what your actualy attempting todo
I'm trying to get aroudn the Great Firewall.
ok it filters http i take it?
it filters whatever the Chinese government feels threatened by.  Or annoyed by.  Or has had a bad day and glanced at briefly.
http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2008/06/18/tunnel-web-and-dns-traffic-over-ssh/
that link i pasted works i just tested it
I tried that the first time you suggested it.  It didn't work.
have you tryd tor
Tor has two problems.  First, it is too slow to be usable.  Second, to get to the Tor web site I have to get past the Great Firewall....
then a ssh tunnel isnt going to save u
